newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albania expects reduced wheat harvest.
newsitem.headline: Albania expects reduced wheat harvest.

text.p: Albania expects a smaller wheat harvest this year due to unfavourable weather and a decline in sowings, a senior Albanian agriculture official said on Wednesday.
Ylli Bicoku, head of the ministry's agriculture and livestock department, said the June-August harvest would be below the 410,000 tonnes reaped last year.
"Wheat production for this year is thought to be lower than last year but exact figures will be available in September," Bicoku told Reuters.
Wheat area fell to 126,000 hectares this year from 142,000 last season, mainly as a result of farmers opting for other crops because of low wheat prices.
But Bicoku said he expected 150,000 hectares to be planted this autumn following a jump in prices last month to 23 leks from 13-15 leks.
